This had previously been marked as delegated, but I've put it back for review. The question is whether linear_ordered_ring should extend nontrivial or add a field (zero_lt_one : 0 < (1 : Î±)).

I'm happy to try either way (currently the PR is written using nontrivial, because I was copying what domain does).
The two approaches are maths equivalent, right?
Yes. It's just implementation details. Really properly answering Reid's question would involve doing it both ways and seeing which one comes out nicer...
Either way you get the other fact as a lemma immediately.
The difference is only about what you have to have "on hand" when constructing instances (either of linear_ordered_ring, or other things like domain, which already expect nontrivial).
So if we have both constructors... then I think I don't care too much
